description: A practical 28-day muscle-building plan using just 16 base recipes in smart rotation. Designed for batch cooking: prep proteins and carbs on Sunday, assemble meals during the week. Targets 1.8g protein per kg bodyweight for an 80kg individual. Based on ISSN position stand recommendations for protein timing and distribution (Kerksick et al., 2017; Jäger et al., 2017). Post-workout meals emphasize fast-digesting protein + carbohydrates within 30 minutes of training.
recipe_list: Chicken Thighs with Rice & Roast Veg
Pork Loin with Quinoa & Roast Veg

meal_prep_sessions.overview: Flexible meal prep system - prep whenever suits your schedule. Each recipe shows weekly needs plus optional extra portions for next week.

custom_prep.covers: Your choice - see individual recipe needs

mixed_roasted_veg.storage: Fridge 4-5 days, not recommended for freezing

fridge_organization: Store proteins and grains in glass containers with tight lids
Keep cut vegetables in separate containers to maintain freshness
Label containers with prep date and contents
Store most perishable items (leafy greens) in crisper drawer
freezer_strategy: Portion proteins and grains in meal-sized containers before freezing
Leave 1/2 inch headspace in containers for expansion
Freeze flat in freezer bags when possible to save space
Move frozen items to fridge 24 hours before needed
food_safety: Cool foods completely before refrigerating (within 2 hours)
Use fridge items within storage timeframes listed
When in doubt, throw it out

microwave.grains: Add 1-2 tbsp water, microwave 90-120 seconds, stir halfway
microwave.proteins: Cover, microwave 60-90 seconds, check internal temp

stovetop.grains: Add splash of broth/water, heat 3-4 minutes stirring
stovetop.proteins: Low heat with oil, 2-3 minutes per side

scaling_notes: Scale all 'scalable: true' ingredients proportionally. For different bodyweights, adjust protein to 1.6-2.2g/kg. Primary scaling levers: protein portions and carb sources (rice, pasta, potato, oats). Post-workout meals should maintain ~2:1 carb:protein ratio when scaled.

meal_prep_session.covers: Core recipes appearing 2+ times this week, plus optional extras
meal_prep_session.recommended_timing: Complete 1-2 days before starting Week 1. Ideal for Sunday prep before Monday start.

ingredients.notes: Will yield 8-10 portions cooked rice for the week
For roasting and steaming throughout week

instructions: PREP SETUP (10 minutes): Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C), wash all vegetables, gather containers
START GRAINS (5 minutes): Begin cooking brown rice in large pot - 400g rice + 800ml water, bring to boil then simmer 45 minutes
PREP PROTEINS (10 minutes): Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, oil, arrange on roasting pan
PREP VEGETABLES (15 minutes): Wash and chop sweet potatoes into 1-inch cubes, cut mixed vegetables uniformly
ROAST BATCH 1 (45 minutes): Put chicken and sweet potatoes in oven, roast 25-30 minutes until chicken reaches 165°F (74°C)
ROAST BATCH 2 (20 minutes): Add mixed vegetables to second pan, roast 15-20 minutes until tender
COOL AND PORTION (30 minutes): Let all foods cool completely, portion into labeled containers
STORAGE PLAN: Store 3-4 days worth in fridge, freeze remainder with clear labels and dates
TOTAL TIME: 2.5-3 hours including cooling | COVERS: 7+ days of base ingredients for multiple recipes

storage_guidelines.vegetables: Fridge 3-4 days, not recommended for freezing

instructions: Cook brown rice according to package instructions (about 45 minutes)
Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and herbs
Heat olive oil in pan, cook chicken 6-7 minutes per side until done
Steam or roast mixed vegetables until tender
Let chicken rest 5 minutes, then slice
Portion into 4 meal prep containers with rice and vegetables
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Makes 4 portions. Store in fridge for up to 4 days. Reheat in microwave 90 seconds.

ingredients.notes: About 1.5 large avocados - add fresh when serving

instructions: Cook quinoa with 2:1 water ratio for 15 minutes
Brown ground beef in pan with onions and spices
Warm black beans in separate pan
Slice avocado just before serving
Assemble bowls with quinoa, beef, beans, and avocado
Store components separately, assemble when eating
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Makes 3 portions. Store beef and quinoa together, avocado separately. Good for 3-4 days.

prep_meals.meal_name: Chicken Thighs with Rice & Roast Veg
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C)
Season chicken thighs with herbs and olive oil
Roast chicken for 35-40 minutes until cooked through
Meanwhile, roast vegetables for 25-30 minutes
Cook rice separately according to package instructions
Let everything cool before portioning into containers
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Makes 4 hearty portions. Reheat thoroughly before eating. Best within 4 days.

ingredients.notes: Use pre-cooked batch rice from previous prep

instructions: Cook ground beef with taco seasoning until browned
Warm black beans with cumin and garlic
Prepare rice (can use pre-cooked batch rice)
Assemble bowls with rice, beef, beans, and toppings
Store in portions, add fresh toppings when eating
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Makes 3 filling portions. Add fresh salsa and cheese when reheating.

ingredients.notes: About 1 cup, steel-cut or large flake for better texture
About 1 scoop, vanilla or unflavored, 25-30g protein content
Medium size, for natural sweetness and quick carbs
Full-fat for creaminess, or use 2% for lighter option
About 2 tablespoons, for healthy fats and crunch
½ teaspoon, for flavor and blood sugar support
½ teaspoon pure vanilla for enhanced flavor
Enhances all flavors and balances sweetness

weekly_portions.recommended_prep: Prep 4-6 portions (includes 1-3 extra for next week)
weekly_portions.storage_life: Fridge: 5 days for oat base, 3 days assembled | Freezer: Not recommended

instructions: In medium heavy-bottomed saucepan, combine oats, milk, and pinch of salt over medium heat
Stir frequently with wooden spoon to prevent sticking, cooking for 4-5 minutes until creamy
Oats should absorb most liquid and reach desired consistency - add more milk if too thick
Remove saucepan from heat completely and let cool for 30-60 seconds to avoid protein clumping
In small bowl, whisk protein powder with 2-3 tablespoons of the hot oat mixture to create smooth slurry
Gradually stir protein slurry back into oats, mixing quickly and thoroughly to prevent lumps
Add vanilla extract and cinnamon, stirring until evenly distributed throughout
Slice banana into rounds and fold half into oats for integrated sweetness
Transfer to serving bowl and arrange remaining banana slices decoratively on top
Sprinkle sliced almonds over surface for textural contrast and healthy fats
Serve immediately while warm for optimal protein absorption and muscle-building benefits
meal_prep_assembly: Remove one portion of pre-cooked oat base from fridge (about 150g)
Add 2-3 tablespoons milk or water to oats in microwave-safe bowl
Microwave for 90-120 seconds, stirring halfway through until heated and creamy
Let cool for 30 seconds, then whisk in protein powder until smooth and lump-free
Stir in vanilla extract and cinnamon until evenly distributed
Slice fresh banana and fold half into warm oats
Top with remaining banana slices and sprinkle with sliced almonds
meal_prep_batch_cooking: Scale oats to 350-525g and milk to 875ml-1.3L for 4-6 portions
Cook large batch of oat base following main instructions but stop before adding protein
Cool completely before portioning into 4-6 glass containers (about 150g each)
Store protein powder portions separately in small containers or bags
Label containers with date and contents
Storage: Fridge 5 days (oat base only), keep protein powder separate
meals.nutrition_timing: Ideal 60-90 minutes pre-workout or within 30 minutes post-workout. Provides 3:1 carb-to-protein ratio for muscle building and glycogen replenishment.

meal_prep_session.covers: Core recipes appearing 2+ times this week, plus optional extras
meal_prep_session.recommended_timing: Complete 1-2 days before starting Week 2. Focus on batch cooking steak, chicken, and turkey for multiple meals.

ingredients.notes: Main protein for Week 2 - appears 3 times
For burrito bowls and power bowls - multiple recipes
For chicken bowls and burrito bowls
For pork loin and power bowls
Large potatoes for baked potato meals

equipment_needed: Large pot for rice and pasta
instructions: PREP SETUP (15 minutes): Preheat oven to 425°F. Scrub and pierce potatoes, start baking (45-60 min)
COOK GRAINS (45 minutes): Start brown rice and quinoa in separate pots with broth for flavor
PREP VEGETABLES (20 minutes): Cut all vegetables uniformly, toss with oil and seasonings
ROAST VEGETABLES (30 minutes): Roast mixed vegetables at 400°F until tender
SEAR STEAKS (15 minutes): Season steaks, sear in cast iron 3-4 min per side, rest 5 min
COOK PROTEINS (25 minutes): Bake chicken at 375°F, brown ground beef and turkey in skillets
SEAR PORK (20 minutes): Season pork loin, sear then oven-finish to 145°F internal temp
COOK PASTA (12 minutes): Boil pasta until al dente, toss with oil to prevent sticking
COOL AND PORTION (30 minutes): Let all foods cool completely, slice proteins, portion into labeled containers
TOTAL TIME: 3-3.5 hours including cooling | COVERS: Core recipes for 7 days of meals

storage_guidelines.proteins: Steak and pork: 3-4 days refrigerated. Chicken: 4-5 days refrigerated. Ground meats: 3-4 days. All freeze well for 2-3 months.
storage_guidelines.grains: Cooked rice, quinoa, and pasta: 5-6 days refrigerated. Store pasta separately from sauce to prevent sogginess.
storage_guidelines.vegetables: Roasted vegetables and baked potatoes: 4-5 days refrigerated. Root vegetables freeze well for 3-4 months.

ingredients.notes: Total for all 6 servings (150g per serving)

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Scrub and pierce potatoes, bake 45-60 minutes
Cut vegetables into uniform pieces, toss with olive oil and seasonings
Roast vegetables for 25-30 minutes until tender
Season steaks with salt, pepper, and garlic powder
Heat cast iron skillet, sear steaks 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare
Let steaks rest 5 minutes before slicing against the grain
Store components separately - reheat gently to avoid overcooking
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Steak best consumed within 3 days. Slice before storing for easier reheating. Can serve at room temperature.

ingredients.notes: Total for all 6 servings (200g per serving)

instructions: Cook brown rice with chicken broth for extra flavor (45 minutes)
Season chicken breasts and bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes until 165°F internal
Steam vegetables until crisp-tender, about 8-10 minutes
Slice chicken and brush with teriyaki sauce while still warm
Portion rice, chicken, and vegetables into meal prep containers
Store sauce separately if desired for freshness
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Keeps well for 4-5 days. Great hot or cold. Add sauce just before eating for best texture.

ingredients.notes: Total for all 4 servings (150g per serving)
Store separately to prevent soggy pasta

instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente
Brown ground turkey in large skillet, breaking into small pieces
Season turkey with Italian herbs, salt, and pepper
Warm marinara sauce in separate pan with additional herbs
Toss cooked pasta with a small amount of olive oil to prevent sticking
Store pasta, turkey, and sauce in separate containers for best texture
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Assemble when ready to eat. Store sauce separately for 4-5 days freshness.

prep_meals.meal_name: Pork Loin with Quinoa & Roast Veg

ingredients.notes: Total for all 4 servings (150g per serving)

instructions: Season pork loin with rosemary, salt, and pepper
Sear pork in oven-safe skillet, then finish in 375°F oven for 20-25 minutes to 145°F internal
Cut vegetables into 1-inch pieces, roast at 400°F for 25-30 minutes
Cook quinoa in vegetable broth for enhanced flavor (15 minutes)
Let pork rest 10 minutes before slicing
Portion quinoa, sliced pork, and roasted vegetables into containers
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Pork stays tender for 4 days when properly stored. Great reheated or at room temperature.

ingredients.notes: Total for all 4 servings (150g per serving)
Use leftover rice from earlier prep

instructions: Sauté diced onions and peppers until tender, about 5 minutes
Add ground beef and brown thoroughly, breaking up clumps
Season with Mexican spice blend and cook 2 more minutes
Warm black beans separately with a pinch of cumin
Layer rice as base, top with seasoned beef and beans
Store fresh toppings like salsa and avocado separately
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Core components keep 4 days. Add fresh toppings when serving for best taste.

ingredients.notes: Total for all 4 servings (135g per serving)
Use quinoa from earlier meal prep
Wilts when combined with warm beef

instructions: Brown ground beef with garlic and onion powder seasoning
Cook until beef is fully browned and seasoned throughout
Layer quinoa in meal prep containers as base
Top with seasoned ground beef while still warm
Add fresh spinach and halved cherry tomatoes on the side
The warm beef will lightly wilt the spinach when mixed
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Best consumed within 3-4 days. Can be eaten cold or warmed briefly.

meal_prep_session.covers: Core recipes appearing 2+ times this week, plus optional extras
meal_prep_session.focus: Salmon and chicken combinations that appear multiple times this week.

ingredients.notes: For salmon & sweet potato plates and salmon pasta - 4 portions
For chicken thighs with rice & roast veg - 2 portions
For beef & quinoa power bowls - 2 portions

equipment_needed: Medium pots for rice and quinoa
instructions: PREP SETUP (15 minutes): Preheat oven to 400°F, gather all proteins and prepare seasoning stations
COOK GRAINS (45 minutes): Start brown rice and quinoa in separate pots with broth for flavor
ROAST VEGETABLES (25 minutes): Sweet potatoes and asparagus on separate baking sheets with olive oil
COOK PROTEINS (30 minutes): Pan-sear salmon fillets, bake chicken breast and thighs, brown ground beef
STEAM VEGETABLES (10 minutes): Steam broccoli until crisp-tender for chicken bowls
COOK PASTA (12 minutes): Boil whole grain pasta until al dente, toss with oil
COOL AND PORTION (30 minutes): Let proteins cool, flake salmon, slice chicken, portion into containers
FINAL ASSEMBLY: Combine proteins with grains and vegetables in meal prep containers
TOTAL TIME: 2-2.5 hours | COVERS: 5 core recipes appearing 2x each (10 total meals)

storage_guidelines.proteins: Salmon: 2-3 days refrigerated. Chicken: 4-5 days refrigerated. Ground beef: 3-4 days. All freeze well for 2-3 months.
storage_guidelines.grains: Cooked rice, quinoa, and pasta: 5-6 days refrigerated. Store pasta separately from sauce to prevent sogginess.
storage_guidelines.vegetables: Roasted vegetables: 4-5 days refrigerated. Steam fresh vegetables for best texture.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Cube sweet potatoes and toss with olive oil
Roast sweet potatoes for 20 minutes until tender
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and herbs
Pan-sear salmon 4-5 minutes per side until flaky
Steam asparagus for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender
Portion salmon, sweet potatoes, and asparagus into containers
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Salmon best within 2-3 days. Can be eaten cold or gently reheated.

prep_meals.meal_name: Chicken Thighs with Rice & Roast Veg
instructions: Season chicken thighs with herbs and roast at 400°F for 35-40 minutes
Cook rice with chicken broth for extra flavor
Roast vegetables alongside chicken for last 25 minutes
Let chicken rest 5 minutes before storing
Portion rice, chicken, and vegetables into containers
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Chicken thighs stay moist for 4 days. Reheat gently to maintain tenderness.

instructions: Season and bake chicken at 375°F for 25-30 minutes to 165°F internal
Cook rice with low-sodium chicken broth
Steam broccoli until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes
Slice chicken and portion with rice and broccoli
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Classic combination that keeps well for 4-5 days. Great hot or cold.

instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente
Pan-sear salmon 4 minutes per side, then flake into chunks
Sauté cherry tomatoes until just softened
Toss pasta with salmon chunks and tomatoes
Store in containers, reheat gently to avoid overcooking salmon
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Best consumed within 2-3 days. Salmon can become dry if overheated.

ingredients.notes: Wilts when mixed with warm beef

instructions: Brown ground beef with garlic and onion powder
Cook quinoa in beef or vegetable broth for flavor
Layer quinoa in containers, top with seasoned beef
Add fresh spinach on the side - it will wilt when mixed with warm beef
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Can be eaten cold or warmed. Spinach adds fresh crunch when added just before eating.

meal_prep_session.covers: Core recipes appearing 2+ times this week - High-Protein Pancakes (5x) and Chicken & Rice Bowl (2x)
meal_prep_session.focus: Pancakes can be batch-made and reheated, plus proven chicken combinations from earlier weeks.

ingredients.notes: Combination of your favorites: chicken, beef, salmon, pork - your choice!
Brown rice, quinoa, pasta - whatever combinations you prefer
Your favorite mix from previous weeks - go for variety and color
Avocados, nuts, seeds, herbs - elevate your favorite dishes
Your favorite sauces, marinades, and spice blends

instructions: Plan your week using favorite recipes from Weeks 1-3
Batch cook proteins using your preferred methods from previous weeks
Prepare grains in the combinations you enjoyed most
Roast vegetables in your favorite seasoning combinations
Create 2-3 different meal combinations for variety
Use advanced techniques learned: proper meat resting, flavor layering
Prepare backup meals you can grab-and-go
Document what worked best for future meal prep sessions

storage_guidelines.proteins: Use storage methods that worked best for you in previous weeks.
storage_guidelines.grains: Store in portions that match your eating patterns.
storage_guidelines.vegetables: Combine storage techniques for optimal freshness.
storage_guidelines.complete_meals: Package meals for convenience based on your schedule.

Cooked in chicken broth for extra flavor
Mix of red, yellow, and orange peppers
Store separately, add fresh before eating
2 tbsp tahini + 1 lemon juice + garlic + water

instructions: Layer quinoa as base in meal prep containers
Top with cubed chicken breast
Add roasted bell peppers and steamed broccoli
Store avocado and dressing separately
Before eating, add fresh avocado and drizzle with dressing
Can be eaten cold or warmed for 1 minute
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: Perfect advancement from Week 1's basic chicken & rice - now with gourmet touches!
equipment_needed: Small containers for avocado and dressing

prep_meals.meal_name: Herb-Crusted Salmon with Sweet Potato & Asparagus

ingredients.notes: Total for all 5 servings (150g per serving)
For juice and zest in herb crust

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C)
Toss cubed sweet potatoes with olive oil, salt, and pepper
Roast sweet potatoes for 20-25 minutes until tender
Mix chopped herbs, garlic, lemon zest, and olive oil for crust
Season salmon with salt, pepper, and spread herb mixture on top
Bake salmon for 12-15 minutes until flaky
Steam asparagus for 4-5 minutes until crisp-tender
Portion into containers with lemon wedges for serving
prep_meals.meal_prep_notes: A restaurant-quality meal that showcases your advanced prep skills! Reheat gently.

meal_prep_session.covers: Weekend finale - light prep for 2-3 days
meal_prep_session.focus: Minimal prep for 2-day weekend finish. Use leftovers creatively.

ingredients.notes: Use any remaining chicken, beef, or other proteins
Whatever looks good - bell peppers, spinach, broccoli
Rice, pasta, or quinoa for 2-3 portions
Fruits, nuts, or healthy snacks for celebration

instructions: Keep it simple - you've mastered the techniques!
Use leftover proteins creatively in new combinations
Steam or quickly sauté fresh vegetables
Cook just enough grains for the weekend
Prepare a few grab-and-go options
Celebrate completing your 28-day journey!

storage_guidelines.proteins: Use within 2-3 days, you're almost done!
storage_guidelines.vegetables: Fresh is best for your final weekend.

ingredients.notes: Total for both servings (150g per serving) - your celebration protein!

instructions: Season steak with salt and pepper, let rest 5 minutes
Sear steak in hot pan 3-4 minutes per side for medium-rare
Let steak rest 5 minutes, then slice against the grain
Layer quinoa in bowls as base
Top with fresh spinach, tomatoes, and cucumber
Add sliced steak and crumbled feta
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving
Enjoy your celebration meal - you've completed 28 days!
